name: electricity production, natural gas, combined cycle power plant | electricity, high voltage | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8501/documentation

This dataset represents the production of high voltage electricity in a natural gas, combined cycle power plant without CHP in Peru. This dataset is based on the dataset "electricity production, natural gas, combined cycle power plant, GLO" (accessed November 2017) and adapted using regional data. The regional data was obtained from power plants that represent 100% of the natural gas combined cycle, electricity production in Peru in 2014.  These four power plants are Ventanilla, Chilca, Kallpa and Fenix Power GN CC. The production of combined cycle natural gas power plants in Peru represents 39.8 % of total production in the country.  Data was obtained from the Committee of Economic Operations of the National Interconnected System (COES), the national peruvian entity that regulates the dispatch and generation of energy from the electricity sector. The COES publishes the statistics of operations of the National Interconnected System (SEIN) in an annual basis.  In addition, public access information was requested from the General Directorate of Environmental Energy Affairs (DGAAE) of the Ministry of Energy and Mines on Environmental Impact Studies (EIA) of the plants in operation in 2014; as well as, the Environmental Monitoring Reports (IMA) presented by the power plants quarterly,  the reports and studies were obtained for Kalpa, Ventanilla, and Chilca. Following  the OSINERGMIN, supervisory body for energy and mining investment (OSINERGMIN, 2015) and aspects of the peruvian natural gas as described in MINEM,2017,  the natural gas emissions were calculated considering US Evironmental Protection Agency emission factors, the emissions  of NOx, CO, CO2, SO2, were estimated using these factors. Organic compound emissions are estimated on the basis of EPA 1998 (as reported in dataset, "electricity production, natural gas, combined cycle power plant, PE, 2008-2008" (accessed November 2017).;In a combined cycle power plant, a gas turbine is followed by a steam turbine. The dataset refers to a combined cycle power plant of 400MWe class with a gas turbine 260MWe and a steam turbine 140MWe.;Sources:;['text', '-\tEPA 1998. US Environmental Protection Agency (1998). Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, AP-42, Fifth Edition, Volume I: Chapter 1: External Combustion Sources, Natural Gas Combustion - Final Section - Supplement D , July 1998. CHIEF (Clearinghouse for Inventories and Emission Factors). Research Triangle Park, North Carolina. http://www.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/.'];MINEM, 2014. Ministerio de Energía y Minas (2014). Anuario Ejecutivo de Electricidad 2014. Dirección General de Electricidad. Retrieved online from http://www.minem.gob.pe/_estadisticaSector.php?idSector=6,  24 august 2017.                       ;COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE, CUADRO N° 6.3 CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE EN LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS 2014,CUADRO N° 6.2 RENDIMIENTO PROMEDIO ANUAL - 2014.  November 14, 2017. ;MINEM, 2017. Ministerio de Energía y Minas (20147).Preguntas Frecuentes en Relación al Gas Natural en el Perú http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/gasnatural.pdf. Retrieved online 24 august 2017. ;OSINERGMIN, 2015. Oganismo Supervisor de la Energía y Mineria. La industria de los hidrocarburos líquidos en el Perú: 20 años de aporte al desarrollo del país (2015 )http://www.osinergmin.gob.pe/seccion/centro_documental/Institucional/Estudios_Economicos/Libros/anexo-industria-hidrocarburos-liquidos-Peru.pdf. Retrieved online 24 august 2017.;EPA, 1998. US Environmental Protection Agency (1998). AP 42 -Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, Volume 1: Stationary Point and Area Sources Compilation of Air Pollutant Emission Factors, AP-42, AP 42, Fifth Edition.  Natural Gas Combustion ;Final Section - Supplement D , July 1998. https://www3.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/ch01/index.html. Retrieved online 24 august 2017.;The split of the natural gas power plants by technology was performed using the data reported by (COES, 2014).;Technology “Turbina a Gas” = Natural gas, conventional;Technology “CC TG-TV”  = Natural gas, combined cycle;;Source: Estadisticas Anuales 2014 02_Estadistica 02_EXCEL 06_PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE DEL SEIN, CUADRO N° 6.8 _COSTOS VARIABLES DE LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS DEL COES.xlsx  URL: http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ accessed on November 14, 2017.

From the constructed  combined cycle natural gas power plant ready to produce electricity. 

From reception of natural gas and operating materials at power plant/factory gate

This activity ends with 1kWh of high voltage electricity produced at the power plant and arrived at the busbar. 

This dataset includes:
 - all operation and maintenance activities and materials of the power plants.
 - Cooling: It is a assumed that all plants use wet cooling with a cooling tower. No cooling tower is included in this dataset (will be implemented in future versions)
 - decarbonised water use for reduction of NOx emissions

This dataset doesn't include 
 - raw materials extraction, decommissioning and waste treatment as these activities are already included in the infrastructure datasets.
 - transformation of the electricity produced.
category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

processDocumentation.timeDescription: The Annual Production Volume is valid for the year 2014
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: In Peru, the Economic Operation Committee of the National Interconnected System (COES) is divided in three operation areas, north, central and south. The four natural gas combined cycle power plants considered in this dataset are located in the central operation area.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Combined cycle power plant of 400MWe class with a gas turbine 265MWe and a steam turbine 140MWe. The plant is used for middle load with 5000 hours of operation at full capacity per year. The plant is assumed to operate 180000 hours during its lifetime.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is based on the dataset "electricity production, natural gas, combined cycle power plant, PE, 2008-2008" (accessed November 2017) and adapted using some regional data. Data from Peruvian power plants that account for 100% of the natural gas combined cycle, electricity production in Peru in 2014, were considered. Net electricity production and effficiency were regionalized. Emissions of NOx, CO, CO2, SO2, and CH4 were estimated using emission factors from EPA, 1998., as per the OSINERGMIN, supervisory body for energy and mining investment (http://www.osinergmin.gob.pe/seccion/centro_documental/Institucional/Estudios_Economicos/Libros/anexo-industria-hidrocarburos-liquidos-Peru.pdf retrieved 24 august 2017) and the characteristics of the peruvian natural gas as described in http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/gasnatural.pdf retrieved 24 august 2017.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Literature and 2014 statistical data from four combined cycle plants operating in Peru.

flow.name: electricity, high voltage
flow.category: D:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/35:Electricity, gas, steam and air conditioning supply/351:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution/3510:Electric power generation, transmission and distribution

exchanges.description:
Calculated emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity by burning natural gas in a combined cycle power plant. Weighted average based on the fuel consumption and net electricity production of four combined cycle natural gas power plants in Peru (COES, 2014) and emission factor from (EPA, 1998). 

Power plant		Net electricity production (GWh)	Natural gas (ft3 10E+3)    
TV  Ventanilla GN CC	3.35 10E+03			2.26 10E+07		
TV Chilca GN CC		5.98 10E+03			3.92 10E+07		
TV Kallpa GN CC		5.80 10E+03			3.81 10E+07		
TV Fénix Power GN CC	1.51 10E+03			1.03 10E+07		
		
Source for electricity production and fuel consumption:
COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE, CUADRO N° 6.3 CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE EN LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS 2014,CUADRO N° 6.2 RENDIMIENTO PROMEDIO ANUAL - 2014.  accessed on November 14, 2017. 


Low heating value of natural gas 9030 kcal/m3	 
Source: http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/gasnatural.pdf accessed on November 14, 2017.

Density of natural gas: 0.65 kg/m3	
Source: http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/gasnatural.pdf accessed on November 14, 2017.


Substance 			Emission factor lb/(scf 10E+6)
Óxidos de nitrógeno (NOx)		140
Monoxido de carbono (CO)		84
Dióxido de carbono (CO2)		120000
Dióxido de azufre (SO2)		0.6
Metano (CH4)			2.3

Source:
EPA AP 42, Fifth Edition, Volume I Chapter 1: External Combustion, 1.4 NATURAL GAS COMBUSTION. Retrieved online from URL: <https://www3.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/ch01/final/c01s04.pdf>  accessed on 24 august 2017.

flow.name: Methane, fossil
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Value taken over from the dataset of natural gas burned in a normal power plant (electricity production, natural gas, GLO 2008). 

Mass share of cooling tower needed for producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the value for burning 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and values of 11 countries 
(AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US) (Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007, JP and US in the appendix) 

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: residue from cooling tower
flow.category: E:Water supply; sewerage, waste management and remediation activities/38:Waste collection, treatment and disposal activities; materials recovery/382:Waste treatment and disposal/3821:Treatment and disposal of non-hazardous waste

exchanges.description:
Literature value/calculated value. Value taken over from the dataset of natural gas burned in a normal power plant (electricity production, natural gas, GLO 2008). 

Emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity, based on the value for burning 1MJ of natural gas. Weighted average with electricity production data (Itten&Frischknecht 2012) and emission values of 11 countries 
(AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US) (Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007) 
Country emissions values estimate from range of values from different references. See Tab. 11.19, p. 138 in Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

(AT, BE, DE, ES, FR, GB, IT, JP, LU, NL, US) (Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007, JP and US in the appendix) 
Country emissions values estimate from range of values from different references. See Tab. 11.19, p. 138 in Faist Emmenegger et al. 2007.

Source: 
Itten R. and Frischknecht R. (2012) Life Cycle Inventories of Electricity Mixes and Grid. ESU-services Ltd., Uster, Switzerland.

flow.name: Hexane
flow.category: Elementary flows/Emission to air/low population density

exchanges.description: Calculated based on literature data.

flow.name: Water, cooling, unspecified natural origin
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/in water

exchanges.description:
Calculated emissions when producing 1kWh of electricity by burning natural gas in a combined cycle power plant. Weighted average based on the fuel consumption and net electricity production of four combined cycle natural gas power plants in Peru (COES, 2014) and emission factor from (EPA, 1998). 

Power plant		Net electricity production (GWh)	Natural gas (ft3 10E+3)    
TV  Ventanilla GN CC	3.35 10E+03			2.26 10E+07		
TV Chilca GN CC		5.98 10E+03			3.92 10E+07		
TV Kallpa GN CC		5.80 10E+03			3.81 10E+07		
TV Fénix Power GN CC	1.51 10E+03			1.03 10E+07		
		
Source for electricity production and fuel consumption:
COES, 2014. Sub Dirección de Gestión de la Información. RA-SGI-0115. ESTADISTICA RELEVANTE DEL SISTEMA ELÉCTRICO INTERCONECTADO NACIONAL, (2014). Cap. 06 PRODUCCIÓN TERMOELÉCTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE. Retrieved online from http://www.coes.org.pe/Portal/Publicaciones/Estadisticas/ 2014/PDF/06_PRODUCCION TERMOELECTRICA Y CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE, CUADRO N° 6.3 CONSUMO DE COMBUSTIBLE EN LAS CENTRALES TERMOELÉCTRICAS 2014,CUADRO N° 6.2 RENDIMIENTO PROMEDIO ANUAL - 2014.  accessed on November 14, 2017. 


Low heating value of natural gas 9030 kcal/m3	 
Source: http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/gasnatural.pdf accessed on November 14, 2017.

Density of natural gas: 0.65 kg/m3	
Source: http://www.minem.gob.pe/minem/archivos/gasnatural.pdf accessed on November 14, 2017.


Substance 			Emission factor lb/(scf 10E+6)
Óxidos de nitrógeno (NOx)		140
Monoxido de carbono (CO)		84
Dióxido de carbono (CO2)		120000
Dióxido de azufre (SO2)		0.6
Metano (CH4)			2.3

Source:
EPA AP 42, Fifth Edition, Volume I Chapter 1: External Combustion, 1.4 NATURAL GAS COMBUSTION. Retrieved online from URL: <https://www3.epa.gov/ttn/chief/ap42/ch01/final/c01s04.pdf>  accessed on 24 august 2017.
